text:
This was our first time trying this particular Wellness Resort, as we were in Bali over Xmas/New Year and were looking for an alternative to our regular Thailand health retreat that we visit annually, prior to returning home.
 
We decided not to commit to the full organised program of things available and decided instead to book room and breakfast and then lock in various activities during our 6 days, which we were advised we could do once we were there. We also chose to pick our meals ourselves from the healthy a la carte food menu.
 
After a few rather frustrating bumps in the road when we first arrived and when trying to lock down a program of various daily activities for our stay - which the General Manager personally addressed once brought to his attention - we could not have been happier.
 
We trained with the trainer every day, we did Aqua yoga and even tried a meditation session laid on by the Resort to see what it was like. We also went out on bicycles our second to last day which was the most enjoyable thing we did.....cycling around Nusa Dua for a couple of hours with a guide from the resort, checking out the area/beaches etc (Small note here mentioning Jaka the trainer who was superb with us, training us hard every day and then being our amazing 'tour guide' on the bikes!)
 
It was a little frustrating that the men's Infra-Red Sauna was not working properly for the entirety of our stay.....something I was keen to do every day as I do it quite a lot in Australia.
 
The food was superb. Healthy and tasty, with various good options available.
 
The rooms were nice and bed comfortable......they don't have televisions, which wouldn't be my preference if given a choice, so make sure you have access to a good book or streaming services if like me you enjoy watching a movie or catching up on a tv series in the evening.
 
Although we were now enjoying ourselves and achieving exactly what we wanted, on our penultimate evening we woke up just after midnight to hear...and then see....a mouse in our room! 
Now we accept that the place is in the trees etc and that you have various creatures around and about outside the suite - which you can hear, particularly at night (as an aside, I saw a metre long lizard wandering slowly past our garden doors one morning!), but this was not something we expected in the room! 
To the credit of the Resort, the guys came to the room to deal with it immediately once I called to reception, but when discussing it the following day with the GM I felt that although he understood this wasn't a good thing for anyone to experience, he didn't really empathise with the impact this had on us (especially the impact on sleeping that night!) - even suggesting at one point that it could have been a gecko.....something if I'm honest that annoyed me, as we (and the guys who came to catch it) had seen it close up! 
If it was my place I would have at least done something for us, nothing big, just something to recognise what had happened...….I don't think this would have changed much from the experience perspective, but it would have felt like there was genuine empathy and pointed to the fact that it wasn't a normal occurrence.
 
So, would we go back again? 
I have to be honest, I don't know. 
The food was superb, the facilities that were fully working were great, the personal training and other activities fantastic, but the experience in the room that penultimate night and the perceived lack of real empathy did have an impact and may be hard for us to get past - which would be disappointing, as the place has a lot going for it.
title: Really great, however.....

text:
We had the most spectacular day at Revivo. The place is truly beautiful and serene. Just walking the site started us talking about how long we would want to stay and in which villas. It was not busy but the sense is that even if full it would feel spacious and calm.

We started with breakfast followed by a presentation on healthy eating by Joshua the Head Chef and we enjoyed hearing him talk about how love and cleanliness are keys to the kitchen. His love and passion for what he does was so evident as is his pride in the garden but in the kitchen this young chef is a super star - seriously. The breakfast menu was overwhelming and amazing particularly considering we had a group consisting of a couple who eat no meat nor shellfish; a ceoliac who is allergic to garlic and onion; and a dairy, fructose and gluten intolerant millennial. Yet everyone was in heaven. After breakfast we left it to Joshua to order the rest of the meals for us and we felt compelled to stay for lunch and dinner each getting better and better ending with sublime desserts. Seriously, for any restaurant it would have been first class but as truly healthy and allergy sensitive meals, the presentation and tastes were Michelin Star quality and something that could and should be a draw card quite aside from the Retreat - particularly for ceoliac and other allergy intolerant eaters would travel miles for this quality of food. The ceoliac in our group was ready to marry Joshua just so he could cook for her.

The Yoga teacher was so sweet and authentic he made us all think of The Love Guru but seriously he was good at what he did and authentic. And the post yoga meditation was sooooo relaxing.

We then did a short TRX session. The instructor was great fun, with a great energy. The gym itself is excellently fitted out.

We then jumped in the beautiful swimming pool for a bit before lunch.

The spa treatments were all first class. The girls had facials. And the massages were really very good. Again the care and sensitivity and obvious love of all staff for their jobs were all obvious.

We then finished the day in the infra red, Bluetooth connected sauna and hot tubs before a fabulous dinner. 

Really all good. 10/10
title: Truly  spectacular wellness luxury

text:
We didn't have much expectation given this is our first wellness retreat. My friend and I  were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the resort, structure of the program and could not have been happier in terms of how we spent our 4 days. Just a few key great points to call out:

1. Customised Program - our response to the survey was taken seriously to come up with a customised program that suits each individual's need. Staff are also very accommodating to move things around during the program. There is a good combination of passive and active exercise and activities that you feel the day is well spent without getting completely exhausted 

2. Quality of staff - overall the quality of the professionals is impressive. We interacted the most with Dr. Sudhin and Jaka
Dr. Sudhin is patient in explaining every element of the food we were taking and the exercise we were doing in how they benefit us. It is great that we can follow up with him even after we leave, he gave us many health tips which we will hopefully follow and see what results we get from them

Jaka is an energetic and positive trainer. We thoroughly enjoy his classes, his positive attitude and how he explains everything in great detail, and taking into consideration needs of everyone in the class (ie someone attending the class has injury on knees and back)  makes the lessons fun and we always look forward to spending time with him

We had great fun with Joanna's lesson too but our program was too short that we only managed to have 1 class with her

3. Food - the meals were beautifully presented and taste as good as it can get for health food of this type. We had wanted to speak to the Chef to thank him but unfortunately he was not around on the day that we left

4. Environment/Attention from Staff - love the fact that there were only a few of us at the resort. It feels very peaceful and non commercial, staff onsite are friendly and helpful and they always care to give you a helping hand on whatever you need

The only feedback I have is on the Treatment. The therapist seems well trained and service was great but the different treatments feel very similar ie we had Relaxation Massage and Lymphatic Drainage Treatment and it feels that there was not much difference between the two, which should not be the case. 

Overall we had a very enjoyable time and hope to come back at some point or try some of your other resorts which I understand will open around Europe and Asia
title: Great Wellness Retreat

text:
A relatively huge property that gives you a lot of own space. A year old with facilities newly built. Impressive collation separate stations for Pilates, Yoga, Mediation, Gym and Steam-Sauna. 
The F&B excelled. The variety caters to every taste and is all so fresh. The breakfast is a generous spread and the green soup is one to be had daily! The banana bread with local honey was the best way to wrap up the morning fare and start the day. The chef in charge, Joshua, accommodated a number of our special requests with no questions asked. 
Of the eight night stay, there was no room to get bored. All the staff members treat the guests as family. It was a lovely cocoon to be at.
We took two day trips with Bayu who is the designated chauffeur at the resort. He aced with the driving and also recommended places to visit. He went out of his way to search for mangoes when I requested to get some to take back home. Speaks English proficiently and is an ardent photographer too! Do ask for him should you be seeking such services. 
The villas are partially refurbished from the prior owners of property. Not as spick as span for a new set up. Dispensers for soaps and hair wash were mouldy - so I didn’t avail to these. Sadly, the spa treatments are not much to write home about. These areas for improvement were conveyed to the site manager who was open to feedback. Probably my bad for expecting perfection at the time!
title: A tranquil oasis

text:
The moment you are driven into the driveway, you start to relax. The grounds are just amazing and very spacious you will get lost in them. The whole atmosphere is very relaxing and the staff make you feel at home straight away. The villas are very spacious and nicely decorated, the bath is just amazing!! I had room with a private pool and was so nice to just jump in and relax in your own garden. I must say I'm very spoilt with great and amazing food (my husband is a Chef...) but the food at REVIVO was absolutely one of the many highlights of my stay.... so fresh, local and unique. It was truely amazing combinations of the freshest produce you can imagine, mixed with all local ingredients and very well presented. 
The wellness consultation was terrific, from the pre consultation whilst still at home, the questionnaire and then when you arrive you are taken care every step of the way to ensure you have the most amazing wellness journey you can imagine. The treatments I had were sublime, the yoga sessions amazing, the only thing I have to complain about is....

Unfortunately I was not there long enough to fully immerse myself in one of the many programs.... so all I can say I have to come back to this amazing wellness retreat which truely is unique in it's kind! See you soon again REVIVO

text:
Before my weeklong solo holiday to REVIVO in Bali, my anxiety/stress and general lack of joy was dangerously starting to affect my life.  I was overworked, overstressed, and unhappy. All I wanted to do was escape to place far away.  I didn't make this decision lightly, in fact I did extensive research to arrive at the conclusion of Bali and then of the newly opened REVIVO Wellness Resort.  I also had never taken a solo vacation or been to a Wellness Retreat before, so I wanted to make sure it was everything I needed it to be. 

Ultimately, it was the best gift I could have ever given myself!  So much so, that this is literally the FIRST Trip advisor review I have ever written.

1) What made me choose REVIVO?

a. Most of the Wellness retreats I found were heavily if not only about yoga (which I had only started) or were glorified spas.  But REVIVO was the only retreat I found that had tailored programs with an organized schedule of various activities and an emphasis on healthy food.

b. Clements (the Front Office Manager) responded to all my emails and even scheduled a call to discuss my questions and concerns.  I was thoroughly impressed with the amount of care, attention, and patience he had with me (to say I asked him about 100 questions would be an understatement!)  He even reassured me with an evacuation plan when I was concerned about any Volcanic activity while I was there (the volcano is well over 100km away and nothing happened while I was there).

c. Kathy (the in-house Wellness Counselor) reviewed my responses to their online questionnaire and was kind enough to also have a quick chat with me.  Speaking to her made me feel like I was going to go somewhere safe and dedicated to taking care of myself.

2) What was my program and daily schedule?

a. Program: “Destress and Relax”.  After my consultation when I arrived they gave me a retreat journal with my daily schedule, meal details, and some mindfulness exercises.

b. My daily schedule:
    a. 7:30 am → someone would deliver 3 shots for me to drink (warm lemon water with salt, turmeric and ginger, and kombucha) It is a wonderful way to wake up your system!
    b. 8-9am → morning yoga group class 
    c. 9-11am→ Breakfast 
    d. 11am-12pm→ group workout class (TRX, Pilates, Maui Tai, or Arial yoga etc..)
    e. 12-3pm→ lunch (I would use the extra time to fit in some swimming and tanning)
    f. 3-4pm→ group Meditation class
    g. 4-4:30pm → snack time
    h. 4:30 -5:30/6 → Spa time
    i. 7pm → dinner

c. Each day we would do a different form of yoga, workout and meditation.  Which kept it interesting and fun! Also ending each day at the spa was H-E-A-V-E-N!  The treatments changed daily, so you get to experience all kinds of pampering ☺ 

d. All the instructors were out of this world – special shout out to Teddy (who always kept us smiling), Ibnu (who led a life altering Qi Gong class), Jaka (who taught me the importance of breathing and to let go), and Andrea (who thoughtfully took extra time to advice me on ayurvedic diet and wellness tips). 

3) What was the food like?

In a word, “AMAZING”!  I had maybe 97% plant based meals and each dish was bright, colorful and packed with wonderful flavor! I was so full that I was honestly convinced I must have been gaining weight from how I cleared each plate – but I actually lost 1.5 KG after my holiday ☺ The best part is they give you some recipes in your daily journal for you to try your favorite dishes back at home!

4) Special Treatment of REVIVO.

a. I was upgraded to a villa with a private pool ☺
b. Upon my request: they organized a tailored 2-day tour (outside of my 5 day program) to see temples, rice fields and anywhere I wanted to go.  My tour guide Bayou was so fun and became my honorary photographer ☺ I highly recommend him!
c. They were so accommodating to any schedule changes I wanted to make, from switching my group workout to a private Pilates class to adding spa treatments.
d. someone met me at the plane, assisted me through the airport, helped me get my bags, before handing me off to the REVIVO driver - the whole process was so easy and amazing.

5) Additional notes:

a. due to a newly constructed over-the-water highway, getting to and from the airport is only 20 minutes! but still far away enough you don't hear airplanes all day
b. the resort is in the middle of the forest, views are mostly REVIVO gardens and beautiful trees.  You truly feel embedded in nature.  
c. I'm not sure if this is a romantic hotel, unless you and your significant other wanted a wellness retreat together, then perhaps yes.
d. the boutique feel of this hotel was charming and relaxing, but also spacious enough that you actually don't see that many guests, and truly get to enjoy peace and QUIET.
e. take my advice and switch off your phones!  Enjoy a good book or wonderful conversation instead :)  or even better the fresh air and sounds of wind in the trees and birds in the sky :)

In essence going on this trip, and choosing REVIVO was the best decision of my life.  Bali is a beautiful and magical place! REVIVO means to be brought back to life, and that is what they did for me.  I will never forget their kindness and their help to restore me.  Each and every staff member made me smile and feel special, I am already planning to go back next year and I hope to see everyone’s kind faces again ☺  If I was this impressed after they had just opened, I can’t wait for how much they will improve after a year!
title: REVIVO (Bali) was the best decision of my life!!

text:
I love spent my 4 days 3 nights Sleep Well Retreat here because everything seemed so perfect. The daily workout classes (2 yogas & 1 cardio) were perfectly made me feel fit, the - 3 times a day- healthy meals were extremely nice and very much detoxifying my stomach (clean eating), the daily spa session was satisfying, and also the consultation session was helped me think clearer. 

The accomodation itself was nice and I love the calmness aura of this resort. Very natural and earthy. But some that I didn't really like was the facilitation in my room. The hot water didn't work in for 2 days. The soaps, shampoo, and conditioner looked like a bit too long to be there because there were some moss inside it. I couldn't found comb as a basic amenities too, and the light was a bit too dim for me. Except that, everything was excellent!

Then, the staffs were super nice. I suddenly got my period there and they helped me to bought sanitary napkins outside the hotel. I feel so sorry but they sincerely help me. And at the same day, I've got super headache at night then asked them if they have some paracetamol. So one of the staff, named Dias, came to my room and gave the prescription medicine from the hotel clinic. Made me very very thankful and valued their kindness so much. It was my first time to received such a services. Feel so homey and touched.

Then, I also got a neck and back problem for a longg long time. At Restoration Yoga, the trainer, Jaka, helped me to fix the problem and he said that I need to have that special treatment to make me feel better. And it worked! My backpain and neck problem just gone. Amazing.

So, there will be too many story to be share here. That's why, I just wanna say, thank you so much Revivo Wellness Resort. You and your staffs are golden. Hope I can be there again one one.
title: Very Relaxing for Mind, Body, and Soul!

text: After 35 years of business and pleasure travel, this hotel ranks as one of the best I have had the pleasure to stay in. We really wanted an away from it all, spa and health break. That’s exactly what we got. The grounds are fantastic, peaceful, ample space to get lost and creat your own space. The food was excellent, healthy, but tasty. So often so called healthy food is dull and tasteless. They managed to combine food and flavours to make every bite delicious. The rooms are large and really top quality, the walled private garden and pool are huge, you could have 100 people and still have room! We threw ourselves into the activities, yoga, kick boxing, meditation, yoga on a surfboard, cycling. You can do as little or as much as you like. I really liked the health advisor Kathy, who did a pre holiday review of your health and goals, followed by a end of holiday outcomes and follow ups.  Very infomrative and done in a very personal way. Last but not least the staff, everyone was on point, never intrusive, always one step ahead of our needs. Absolutely fantatic. I very rarely post reviews, but felt this hotel and staff deserved the time and effort to say, well done and thank you!
title: Fantastic

text: I've been to many nice hotels & places but only in Revivo I've healed. I've stayed at Revivo for 2 months I can summarize it in one sentence (It changed my life) Mentally, Emotionally and Physically. I came for a weight loss & relaxation but weight is not the only thing I have lost... I lost many bad issues I have been battling with for 11 years. wellness centers give you tools only but at Revivo I felt home it made me focus more in me. I am forever grateful. text:
I actually would suggest a few improvements.

1. Fix bidet in the toilet. As Southeast Asians, we usually use a bidet after passing motion. 
2. More amenities such as a comb and a shaver would be much appreciated.
3. Lack of plug point at the vanity area for use of hair dryer.
4. With a slightest turn of the key to lock the room, the key broke off and when I brought it to the reception the receptionist immediately asked me to pay for it. Keys are subjected to wear and tear and the action of the receptionist to immediately say, "Ok you broke it, you have to pay for it" just spoiled my day.
5. The road entering the resort could use some improvements. My Grab driver basically almost got lost from the dark roads and the lack of signage.
6. Tried to arrange for yoga classes in the morning throughout my 3 days 2 nights stay but was told it is not available.
7. We were showed the sauna room and the rest of the facilities, but from the pdf  brochure it seems that all of that had to be paid for you to use it. So we rather not try it.

For the price of the room, I had expected more.
title: Not what I had expected it to be

text:
Truly restorative experience at Revivō. I signed up to a mindfulness program, all-inclusive, and it was the best move I’ve made for my continued health and sanity.

They custom-made a program for me that included morning yoga daily, meditation, Tibetan singing bowls, aerial yoga, HIIT, reiki, private assisted stretching, Pilates and even a cooking class. Massages daily — wow.

The food is mostly plant-based but they do serve chicken, steak and fish, and it’s all so wholesome but delicious. The healthy drinks are great too!

My villa was close to everything so was very convenient, spacious and quiet. Had a shower, bathtub and its own big pool and garden. So I had lots of time to relax and read outdoors.

Most of all the staff were amazing. The personal trainers, consultants, room cleaners, spa staff and the restaurant staff were all so professional and so good at making everyone feel heard and taken care of. Would highly recommend for a life-changing experience!
title: Amazing and restorative wellness holiday in Bali

text:
I will start off by saying, this is my second time to Bali and in both vacations I chose Revivo as my sanctuary - and I would easily choose it again!! Reasons I chose Revivo :

- Only 16 villas, meaning it's not loud or crowded, and the epitome of peaceful. On that note, it's luckily a no-kids kind of property (sorry kiddos!)

- The Wellness Retreat aspect of Revivo is very well rounded and includes DAILY: yoga, mediation, workout classes, and spa! Also, amazing meals for the diet of your preference - I chose to go vegan for my stay and the food was out of this world. Your days and meals are planned and printed out in a journal they give you when you arrive. Not having to think of what to do next is surprisingly relaxing!

- They always have something extra you can add to your experience, such as: cupping, sound healing, or acupuncture (my first trip), maxo (second trip). And in general they are very flexible to move around/swap out or adjust the program they have designed for you

- EVERYONE at the resort knows your name and are very well informed about your preferences and are all attentive to your every need. By far one of the best and friendliest hospitality teams I've met. 

- The stars of their resort for me were: Jaka for yoga/PT (I felt so empowered!), Su for sound healing (WOW!!), Gusto for one-on-one meditation (TRANSFORMATIONAL!!), and Thinley, wellness consultant, she will help guide you during your retreat to collect the tools needed to take certain things you learn home with you. This dream team is literal magic - I highly recommend you book sessions with each, trust me you won't regret it!

- Lastly, I have to commend their concierge team for helping me to plan some day trips around beautiful Bali!

For me Revivo is turning into my "Go To" when I need a break from work/life stress and just want to recenter and refocus.
title: AMAZING Hidden Tranquil Wellness Resort

text:
What a great time I had at REVIVO! REVIVO provided a unique and personalised experience. Staying at REVIVO for ten days was the best holiday I have ever had, allowing me to get out of my comfort zone, explore Balinese traditions and culture, and gain new and invaluable experiences like an entire moon ceremony. I never once felt like I was another number, and I strongly recommend to everyone to enjoy the REVIVO  wellness centre once in their lifetime.

text:
This place is amazing if you want to go into a blissful health retreat bubble.
We spent 6 nights here and loved every moment.
The program is fully customised for you, including the meals although you can choose from the menu if you would like a last minute change. 
Thinley does a great job of making sure you get the most out of your stay.
The fitness team were amazing, special shout out to Su and Jack. The attention and care was extraordinary.
The infrared sauna and steam rooms were located in the facilities by the main pool and each gender has their own, you need to let the team know when you may want to use them and they will organise.
All spa treatments were lovely, the spa team are beautiful people that make you feel so comfortable and relaxed.
Loved all the food and really felt the physical benefits in a very short time.
There is a cocktail and wine list if you feel like a tipple, just ask for it. 
We had a private pool villa and loved it. 
The room fridge is stocked with infused waters and we are still in pursuit of the lovely rosella tea they supplied.
I cannot recommend this place enough and would love to return.
Thank you to the whole team. We hope to return and were sad to leave. :)
title: AMAZING retreat experience 10/10

text: Revivo is the perfect place to unwind, de-stress and switch off from the stresses of modern life. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. I was so stressed-out from work and this place fully met my needs. So much so we cancelled a few days off our subsequent Airbnb accommodation so we could go back here at the end of our trip. Firstly, it's really tranquil and beautifully designed. The grounds are gorgeous. The massages are first class, (so good i was so relaxed i fell asleep twice!). The facilities are amazing!, fantastic gym, pilates, yoga, spa, sauna, jacuzzi, steam room, infra-red room, we got addicted to the hot/cold plunge pool. So many options, plus a Huge swimming pool, + a generous sized pool in our private villa. Our private villa had an additional outdoor shower which was amazing to shower under the moonlight. The staff are wonderfully attentive, warm and genuine and will go out of their way to meet your requests no matter how annoying they might be. The food here in the restaurant is delightfully healthy. Breakfasts fit for a king! If you have dietary requirements, e.g gluten-free, vego, etc, you'll be happy with the options. After our first stay we had a slight complaint about there being a slight gap in the private villa wall which meant that potentially people could see in to your private garden area /private shower area. We were not expecting any action to be taken, maybe a plant or a bamboo screen to fill the gap but by the time we came back 9 days later they had actually filled the gap structurally with brick / concrete and colour matched and blended it into the existing structure, like magic, you'd never would have known that there had been a gap. Amazing! Totally above and beyond our expectations. We want to go back here every year when life gets a bit much and i don't hesitate to recommend it to anyone in need of a restorative quiet relaxing break.
title: Amazing! Tranquil and restorative. The perfect antidote to city living and the pressures of life.

text:
I planned this trip for a long time and it was to be a bucket list solo trip for my 50th birthday. I was hoping for a relaxing stay in a luxury resort. Paying 300USD a night I was thinking I was going to have a lovely 5 star experience but I was very sadly mistaken! I arrived around 4pm - 5pm very excited about my journey but as soon as I arrived I got a bad feeling I was not in the right place. This resort is NOT five star and definitely not value for money. The staff I dealt with were lovely so I can't fault their hospitality but the resort seriously lacks ambience. The jacuzzi looked unclean and not inviting at all. The outdoor furniture in the bar area also felt & looked dirty. I was shown around the main resort area which is quite underwhelming and had a very strange vibe about it.. Almost on the spooky side! I was then told I would be taken to my garden villa by car because it was quite a way from the main area. So anytime I wanted to use the pool or go for a massage or go for a drink I had to phone for the car to collect me which I did not like at all. This should have been explained when booking as it really is very isolated from everything. My villa was very large and the bedding looked clean but the bathroom (mainly vanity top and bath) was not clean. It looked like it hadn't been cleaned since before covid. The villa was also a bit dated as was the resort itself. I would not have liked being so far from the main area at night as it felt very very isolated but if that is what you are looking for then this place could be for you. So at this point I asked to check out as I knew I was not going to enjoy my stay here.
There is also no TV in the room which some would be OK about but if you are solo and in this villa you will have very little to do at night. 
The general manager was however very good at coming to a reasonable resolution and I forfeited one night and they refunded me the other 3 nights which I was appreciative for. They also offered me a free massage but I declined. So thank you to the staff who handled the situation well. I do however think that they are charging far too much for this resort when there are much nicer and cheaper options available in the same area.
title: Not what I was expecting!

From the minute I arrived at Revivo I was made to feel completely welcome. The staff were all extremely polite and nothing ever seemed too much trouble. The food was all tailored to my individual requirements and I have to say it was absolutely delicious. The chef and kitchen team do an amazing job. I joined a few of the activities such as the spiritual morning blessing at the resort temple, aerial yoga and the spa. Everyone took their time, gave excellent explanations and nothing seemed too much trouble. The team was visible around the resort or in the restaurant or bar to answer any questions etc. Thank you to Sofyan, Kim & Josh.  
The resort is extremely spacious with many rooms clustered around their own pools. It was nice to be able to mix and mingle with other guests and everyone staying there seemed really happy. Rooms offer a lot of space, excellent in room amenities and most importantly, a beautiful nights sleep. 

Would highly recommend if you need a digital detox and mind and body reset. Would go back in a heartbeat.

text:
Wonderful experience in a beautiful location.

After a lot of research of wellness retreats I chose Revivo for it’s beautiful rooms and surroundings. I had the rare opportunity to travel alone without my family and the stresses of work to for some much needed rest, relaxation and reset so seclusion was what I was after.

I arrived late after a long journey and I was pleased be checked in quickly and show to my room. I was asked if I would
like a small meal brought to my room which I was very grateful for. 

My luggage sadly didn’t arrive with me but thankfully Sofyan arranged for a clean set of yoga clothes to be left in my room twice a day (after sessions) until my luggage arrived. He also followed up with the airport to locate my luggage and it was delivered late on my second day. 

The meals are delicious, healthy and catered to my fussy appetite. The staff are all very attentive, helpful and an asset to the resort as a whole. 

I enjoyed the yoga at the start of the day with a gentle schedule that followed with an exercise class, mediative yoga and a spa treatment spaced throughout the day. 

Within a day I felt a million miles away from my hectic life and took the opportunity to slow down and enjoy the pace and peace that Revivo have to offer.

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and I am planning on returning with my husband as I felt his missed out on this wonderful experience.
title: Peace and tranquillity

text:
I’ll start with the pros:

1. Kimberly, Sofyan, the head chef, the restaurant manager, and the staff are lovely people who tried their best. 

2. Food was very good and healthy. 

3. Hotel grounds are beautiful.  

4. Spa treatments were pretty good if you end up with the right therapist. 

Cons:

1. The driver from revivo was 45 minutes late to pick me up from my previous hotel and when I arrived at revivo they wanted to charge me right away for the car transport upon check in. Instead they should either remove it from the bill or add it to the final bill, at the very least.  

2. The wellness manager was not around during the first day of my wellness program and no one informed me of my upcoming schedule for the following day.  

3. The reception called me early the next day and woke me up asking if I’m joining some ceremony at their temple which no one had told me about because I hadn’t received my schedule or been informed. 

4. The HIIT class had an awful instructor who borrowed my phone as a timer and ended up sweating all over it. She even forgot some of her own routines. This quality of instruction was very shocking to me for how much I was paying. 

5. The yoga instructor also taught Pilates and cardio and as lovely as he was I didn’t find the beginning and endings of the classes very engaging because he would spend 5 minutes at each point asking us to “thank god” for everything and for our bodies and health. Everyone is entitled to their own beliefs but when it’s incorporated in a class like that daily it becomes a bit annoying and redundant. 

6. The daily classes are all the same for everyone so it’s not bespoke like the website says, unless you specifically ask for a class you’re interested in and in my case I asked for a meditation class. The wellness program needs to incorporate classes like breath work, meditation etc. and the program should take guests’ individual needs into account. 

7. The restaurant, the lounge area and the pool didn’t have any music / ambiance and you can hear other people’s conversations during mealtimes. 

All in all I wish I hadn’t booked this retreat for 7 nights and just gone for 3 nights instead because I ended up having to forfeit 3 nights of the room worth $900 due to my underwhelming experience. For a high end resort negotiations should not take place with the customer if they’re feeling dissatisfied. 

If you’re looking for a well-oiled wellness resort that offers comprehensive treatments check out Kamalaya in Thailand instead.
title: Much room for improvement

text:
I went to Bali for 10 days, 3 of which I spent in Revivo Wellness Resort Nusa Dua Bali to enjoy a wellness retreat, being this the highlight of my whole trip. 
First things first, the staff is absolutely amazing. Since I arrived I felt really welcomed by everyone; the quality of service and kindness of all of the staff was one of the best parts of the whole experience. 
Prior my arrival I received an email with a questionnaire to personalise the wellness program I had selected, directly from the wellness director, Kimberly Rose. I met with her the first day I arrived to discuss the questionnaire and receive my personal schedule with the different activities I was going to do during the 3 days (including yoga classes, meditations, spa services, high-intensity workouts which in my case I chose muay thai (amazing!!!) and meal schedule).  I have to thank the attention to detail, warmth and professionalism of Kimberly, she was outstanding explaining the process, listening to my requests and with the follow-ups. 

The food was curated for me, every day was something different I had not tried before and really delicious and healthy; I do have to say my favourite was breakfast, I have incorporated some of the plates I tried in Revivo to my everyday meals.

I was in a garden villa and it was really beautiful and amazing, as well as the whole resort; the tranquility and serenity of the place makes it perfect for a retreat.

If you need a break from everyday life, disconnect from everything and be in an idilic setting but feel like home far away from home at the same time, you should definitely try to come to Revivo.
I decided to not use my phone for the 3 days ( they encourage you to disconnect but it is up to you to do so) and I really enjoyed my time to relax, learn yoga (had two classes per day), try muay thai and really enjoy the massages (the therapists are amazing!)
I know I am probably repeating myself, but I truly believe the staff is what really makes the difference; there is many 5 star places (which if you look at the photos we can all agree it is), but what you really remember is the way people made you feel, and that is exactly what I say every time I share my experience and obviously, recommend it!
title: once in a lifetime must-do

text:
I stayed at the Revivo Wellness Resort Bali for 4 nights. Right from the start at the airport pick up the service was flawless. 

The accommodation was spacious and spotlessly clean and management have thought of everything with all the in-room amenities from the carry basket and hats to the torch, international power adaptor, mosquito repellant, and sarong.  

The personalised wellness program is presented to each guest with a daily schedule of activities and meals that are customised to the individual. The exercise program includes a range of various activities with a range of yoga classes, meditations, and high-intensity workouts. 

The day spa services are first class with amazing therapists the massages and body scrubs were so relaxing, The facilities at the resort are excellent and the swimming pool is pristine, the perfect place to relax and enjoy the warm sun. 

The restaurant menu is delicious and healthy and those on the wellness program will have their meal plan customised to suit their needs. Everything in the scheduled program from meals to exercise is flexible and there are always staff on hand to discuss this with.

I would highly recommend a stay here for focusing on self and really relaxing, it is truly brilliant.

text:
Came for 7 days and was not disappointed.  For only being open for 1 month after being closed for 2 years Sofyan and his team were outstanding.  From the VIP wisk through the airport to our hotel car awaiting us with water and snacks to the very private resort, it was all wonderful.  We had villa #1 which to be honest was the best in the place for us.  Located centrally, right next to the spa, close to gym and restaurant made everything so easy.  It had a private very well shaded pool.  If you wanted to sunbathe, the main pool or the spa pool would work better.  This private pool is well shaded with trees and a nice grass area with lounge chairs and a table/chairs  All the villas are pretty much the same layout and include a big bath, spacious sleeping area, AC and fans and amenities like coffee and tea.  Housekeeping is trying to catch up so a couple of mornings we had to get our coffee refilled but the F&B director (who seems to always be there) was prompt to take care of.  The pace is chill and mindful.  Without a doubt, some of the best tasting food we have had--ever and we have been all over the world.  Each meal is individually prepared, hot and delicious.  They are very conscious of timing of the meals and much more slow and deliberate than US restaurants.  
We also felt like we owned the place.  Many times, we were the only ones eating in the open air restaurant and never had to share the main pool with anyone.
Kimberly, the health and wellness coordinator (and an amazing acupuncturist)  was truly a blessing for us.  She is a hospitality expert from Canada so having an english as a first language person assist us was helpful.  She also handled everything we needed from menu suggestions we wanted, spa services, work out needs and local suggestions.  The whole staff was great but Kimberly whet above and beyond at every opportunity.  

   A summary by department would be-- F&B--amazing food and service.  Supporta (spelling?) the head of the department was on top of every detail and had his staff doing amazing work.  The Chef could be at any 5 star restaurant.  The staff was alway attentive.  Even with the owner in town, who demanded a ton of attention, service never faltered.  Wellness-- the two main fitness instructors, Gusto and Jaka (sp??) were great, energizing and very good.  They are better than any of the yoga teachers I have gone to before and definitely more flexible!!  They modified each program to fit each persons needs.  A great offering of yoga, meditation and fitness.  The spa programs were also very relaxing, therapeutic and we had no trouble booking.  Again, we were there when the resort wasnt totally full but with the limited number of rooms, should not be an issue.  Again, Kimberly has collected a world class team.  Housekeeping--Room was always spotless, make well and taken care of.  There were a few items forgotten as mentioned above but nothing that caused any issues.  And if we needed anything, they came promptly.  Front office.  easy check in, fast check out, assistance in helping us with a tour and drivers so overall, met all of our needs.  Management--Sofyan, the GM was always on property and walking around to help us.  An example of the service is that we wanted to stay longer--the resort could accommodate but the airlines was troublesome.  He called them for us to help overcome the language barrier and when that didnt work, he went with another guest and on our behalf tried to get it changed at the airport.  So far above and beyond what was expected.

Overall and amazing place, wonderful people.  Unforgettable experience.
title: Revivo Bali May 2022

text:
We stayed here for 5 days 4 nights on immersive wellness level 3 program which includes daily exercises, spa treatments, 4 meals and meditation or other activities. 

From consultation to booking to having to do last minute change due to unforeseen circumstances (i.e CODVID!) the staff have gone over and above to accommodate us. 
Once we arrived we can immediately  sense the peaceful and serenity vibes of the resort, the staff are diligently working behind the scenes to keep the place immaculate, every fallen leaf is swiftly swept away. 

I’m amazed by the level of personalization they can do with such limited staff, and nothing was too much trouble and they always delivered with a smile!

Initially I was worried about the healthy food as I signed up for the detox program but the healthy food was not only delicious but also very presentable like at a fine dining restaurant. 

All the activities throughout the day is the highlight that keeps you engaged, focused yet relaxed at the same time. I met 3 trainers there for yoga & pilates, circuit training and aerial yoga, all were very knowledgeable and passionate about what they do, they gave us lots of tips and confidence to gently push ourselves to improve each day. 

Kimberly is an absolute star with her wealth of experience and knowledge on anything wellness related and she’s very happy to share all her secrets and tips to help you on your wellness journey even after your stay. 

Having stayed at other high end wellness retreats, this one is very special and we enjoyed every aspect of it!

text:
It’s my first time in Bali. And I wanted to choose a wellness resort where we can chill and take care of myself and my husband.

The best part of Revivo is that all the staffs are really warm and friendly. I felt like I have a Balinese family while I stayed at Revivo. They are genuinely happy to help and engage with visitors. The proactiveness and kindness are best part during our stay.

Secondly, there’s everything you need: massage, yoga, meditation, acupuncture, personal training and work out classes everyday.

Third reason why I loved staying at Revivo is very customizable and flexible. To be honest, I didn't have a high expectation toward food before visiting here.  You might get bored with food only available on the menu.  I wanted to eat more local food, so I asked the staff. And I had green curry, chicken satay and barbecue. They were delicious.  They had a struggle to get ingredients. This is because  they just opened after pandemic, which is very understandable for current circumstances. I am very happy that I had a delicious Indonesian food. And most importantly very gluten friendly. My husband has a celiac disease. I was happy that he could get food without any stress. Staffs were very aware of Gluten free allergy.  We love their gluten free banana flour bread. 

Also we had an airport transfer and express immigration and custom process. 
It was the best experience 😍 we were stressed and worried about the uncertainty of immigration process because of Covid-19.  The hotel suggested us the service and I am so happy the process has been taken care of smoothly. 

Lastly after pandemic, I prefer having a small and intimate stay.  I hope that a hotel has not too many people and a private atmosphere.  It was perfect for that. Of course, you have to keep it in mind that everything is a bit distant since you are in the middle of forest. They have a 15min free shuttle service. If you want to go visit other hotels in Nusa Dua, you can. So I recommend  this hotel if you would like to have a hassle free trip and relax.
title: Amazing destination of an exclusive getaway for 2022 after pandemic

text:
This review is long overdue, but finally found the time to write it!
I stayed at Revivo for a whole week, taking part in one of their wellness retreats and I have to say the experience did not disappoint. 
From the moment I stepped out of the plane, the experience already starts with someone picking you up and fast-tracking you through security. 
Once at the property, they kindly upgraded me to a poolside suite, which was super spacious and with a private pool to be shared with the suite next door. Besides the private pool, there was also a common big pool which one could use if they wanted more space and wasn't crowded at all, so perfect for relaxing. 
The property itself was super clean, while keeping the traditional Bali elements in their decor. The staff was also super friendly and helpful, even accommodating my super late checkout and letting me stay at the room until 8pm that night. 
Food wise, I was quite impressed! I didn't eat a piece of bread in that whole week, and I didn't even miss it. They have an extensive menu to spice up your lunch/dinner and make sure you enjoy eating healthy. 
The daily classes were also super enjoyable and beginner friendly. They were also very flexible in changing my schedule to better suit my needs, which i really appreciated. If you decide to go, don't miss the HIIT class with Aya and the water yoga with Dr Sudhin. The first one makes you work hard and the second one is super fun. 
All in all, would recommend to anyone looking to reset or need an escape from the daily life. It is definitely a place where you will find other solo travelers looking for a reset. I can't wait for the opportunity to come back again!
title: Perfect to pause and reset your life

text:
Was in Revivo Bali from 19 Dec to 22 Dec, with only a handful of guests (I understand it was the lull period), it was really a wonderful stay. 

Our intention was simple - to find a quiet get a way that would allow us to rest, relax and recharge through multiple wellness regimes. The program designed was very well-thought-out and helped us achieve all the above. From clean, tasty and nutritious food, to the intense but doable fitness training as well as the relaxing and pampering spa sessions, nice and comfy bedding, we are truly rested and recharged. 

The trainers are attentive and would pace the training sessions according to how well you could handle it. Gym and training equipment is in pristine condition, trainers teach and won't just push for the sake of it.  

Housekeeping was done well, every evening, the insect repellent coil will be lit up when we are away from the room. Every staff will pay attention to your needs and wants - for example, we ordered more food for some meals and moving forward, wait staff would ask us before hand if we'd like to order more for the next meal. 

One teeny weeny flop was that the pool could be clean a little more regularly. Both pools - the main and our private - had fallen leaves, twigs and at a point, collected dust/ particles on the surface. We don't swim (not much energy left after 3 exercises per day), but it would be great that the pool(s) could be cleaned more often such that the guests could at least kick water at the end of the day.
title: Wellness Retreat at Revivo that really revived our wellness

text:
Revivo means ‘to live again’ and this goregous wellness resort lives up to its promise. I have suffered from bouts of insomnia for years, so when I heard about their 3-day sleep retreat I couldn’t wait to sign up. Once I booked, I got a really detailed questionnaire to fill in, and then had a one hour wellness consultation with a doctor on arrival, so that the team of wellness coaches could create a fully personalised schedule designed specifically for me to tackle my sleep issues.  It was this personalization that really sets Revivo apart – because of course individual sleep problems stem from different issues, so the approach needs to be different for everyone. It seems I suffer from something like anxiety when it comes to sleep so my schedule was filled with calming yoga and meditation practices and deeply relaxing spa treatments (sheer heaven!!), as well as food that was rich in melatonin and serotonin which encourage better sleep.  I have done retreats before which have a general schedule that everyone participates in, but here it was all about me, and I have to admit, I felt like a bit of a rock star with my own entourage of wellness coaches, spa therapists, fitness trainers and chefs cooking nutritional and very tasty food just for me. Everything was so well-scheduled that although there were other guests, I barely saw anyone, so there were no awkward conversations with a stranger in the pool, and no tiresome small talk at breakfast, I could just get on with my healing journey in relative solitude, which was just what I needed. I mean how often does it get to be just about yourself? These moments really count and for three days it was like I was immersed in a cocoon of wellness.
 
Some of the villas have their own pool, but I generally had the main pool to myself – what a treat, with its gorgeous day beds canopied in white bougainvillea and covered with plump cushions that just seem to beg you to sink right in. My schedule was pretty full with various wellness activities, but when I had some downtime, I loved lying in the shade overlooking the teak forest and listening to the cicadas. I think the best thing about this retreat is that even though I cherished every moment of it and never wanted it to end, in a way it never really did end, because here I am, back home in Sydney two months later, and still reaping the benefits. Ok, it wasn’t like I suddenly miraculously started sleeping better from day one at the retreat, but for the first time in my life and thanks to my detailed wellness consultation with Dr Sudhin on arrival, I came to really understand the nature of my sleep issues.  Better still, I was then armed with tools to overcome them. And slowly I have made the necessary lifestyle changes, and now act with a lot more awareness, particularly in terms of keeping up a regular yoga and breathing practice, and keeping my evenings device free. And yes!! I sleep so much better, and when I do wake up in the night, I generally go back to sleep. So in a way it has been a kind of miracle. Truly this is one of the most profound and deeply transformative vacation experiences I have ever had and I cannot recommend it highly enough. Thank you so much to GM Sammy and to Dr Sudhin and Andrea and the talented chefs and all the wonderful staff for taking such good care of me. I hope so much to come back one day.
 
Some more detail……
 
Classes: I did Hatha yoga, Yin yoga, Cyclic breathing, hydrotherapy, mindfulness meditation and personal fitness training. All the teachers are really well trained and empathetic, and I really appreciated that everyone knew that I had an old neck injury to contend with, and altered my practice accordingly. It was wonderful to feel so well cared for. Revivo offer lots of other classes which are scheduled specifically to your retreat, from boxing, to high energy cardio and aerial yoga. I think a lot of people do the weight loss retreat, and I met someone doing the golf and pilates retreat which sounded pretty cool.
 
Spa: Each day I was thoroughly spoiled with a divine spa treatment! The spa facilities were fabulous, with private treatment rooms and highly skilled therapists. The highlight for me was the shirodhara, where warm oil was drizzled onto my forehead to sooth my mind and induce deep relaxation – it sent me into a state of absolute bliss!
 
Suites: My suite, set in pretty tropical gardens was massive, with a four-poster bed topped with luxury linens. The fridge had various types of infused water and there was fresh fruit and healthy snacks. I loved the sunken bathtub and the tray with bath salts and herbs and candles so you could create your own bath time ritual - perfect for getting a good rest.
 
Food: It was so nice not to have to think about what to eat or drink, I just had to turn up at my allotted meal times, and OMG, the food was so good. I am vegetarian and my menu was created entirely for me, filled with fabulous food and drinks with names like ‘heal me sleepy’ and  ‘green dream’.  The wellness journal I was given on arrival even included recipes so I have been able to make myself some of the dishes at home.
 
The staff: Honestly, I have never felt so nurtured or cared for, the staff were unbelievably kind and caring and the wellness coaches so experienced and knowledgeable, I felt that they genuinely wanted to help me to lead a happier and healthier life. It was quite a humbling experience and one that I will be forever grateful for.
 
The retreats are not cheap, but actually, considering the level of service, expertise and luxury they are great value. It’s about the same as you would pay for a 5-star hotel, but all the food, activities and spa treatments are also included.  And really, what better thing to invest in than your health and wellbeing, and setting yourself up for a happier life. You just can’t really put a price on experiences like this.
title: Truly Transformative

text:
As part of my 50th birthday present, my family gifted me with a 4 nights stay at Revivo Nusa Dua to rejuvenate, relax and come home completely reinvigorated.   From the minute I was picked up at the airport to the final drop back, I experienced the most amazing time, in the care of amazing staff, and in the most tranquil environment.  You honestly felt like you'd arrived in paradise.

My stay included the airport transfers.  Upon check in, I was personally greeted by the General Manager, Sammy Ibrahim, who certainly laid out the red carpet welcome experience and made me feel most welcome.  I loved the boutique feel of the private pool villas which were exquisite with all the right amenities (private pond, outdoor shower, bathtub overlooking the garden, mini bar complete with daily made fruit and tea infused waters etc).

Once I arrived, I soon had an appointment with the Natropath and had an in-depth consultation so that the staff could create a personalised wellness plan for each day which was documented in a beautiful journal for me to follow.

I've enjoyed ordering from the pillow menu at 5-star resorts, but this was my first to have separate menus for my food, yoga, meditation, fitness and spa treatments! As an example, I could choose from: meals - anti-ageing, detox, sleep well, etc; yoga - hatha, aqua, aerial, restorative or ashtanga yoga;  fitness - pilates, gym, aerobic workouts, 

Even after 1 day, my mind was in a much more rested place.  By the end of my 5th day, my body composition had changed and I had lost 3% fat and gained 3% in muscle mass, so I felt healthier, mentally stronger and more toned.  

I can't recommend this resort more highly if you are looking to focus on your inner health and wellbeing.  While the resort is amazing in itself (facilities, staff, location, etc), to get the most out of the experience, you have to do the program which is all encompassing - meal plan, mindfulness classes, exercise classes, yoga classes and a lovely pampering spa treatment to finish off your day!
title: TRANSFORMATIONAL WELLNESS EXPERIENCE!

text:
My partner and I stayed 6 nights at Revivo Nusa Dua. It is 
Up in the hills away from the beachfront bustle, quiet and private with a walled compound surrounding most of the complex, the grounds are immaculate with lawns, trees and walkways and many places to sit and relax. Most villas share a pool between two i believe, though we had our own backyard and pool and there is a larger pool that all guests can use.The villa had outdoor and indoor showers and a deep bath, marble floors and a high ceilinged (handwoven) balinese thatched roof. The facilities, food and service were all first class, with very kind attentive staff. If you so desire there are yoga/meditation classes, spa treatments of all descriptions and massages available. The food is something else, very creative use of spices with many ingredients grown on site, it is low fat low carb low salt and low sugar so a bit of an adjustment for me, though on returning home I discovered  I had lost nearly 5 kilos just from eating the Revivo diet!
I definitely recommend this experience if you have a stressful work life and need to really treat yourself well, or if you like to go on yoga retreats but like to do it in style.
title: Just Beautiful

text: If anyone is looking for a quality wellness resort,  REVIVO in Bali should be your destination. The minute you land in Denpasar airport, your VIP treatment will start with airport staff greeting you at the gate and escorting you through "fast line" and to REVIVO car which will be waiting for you. The resort is ~ 35-40 min away from the airport. Upon arrival, your retreat schedule will be delivered and the schedule can be modified to make even more personalized after few days if needed. Retreats are individually designed and may include fitness training, Hatha Yoga, Restorative Yoga, Kick boxing etc. Resort Staff and GM all will come to greet you on your arrival and throughout your stay you will witness how genuinely the resort staff care about their guests and their willingness to go "above and beyond" for their guests is unparalleled. Coaches are highly qualified. The program I have selected (detox and weight loss) had daily massage which was the highlight of my day. The Spa uses all-natural products and I would recommended all the massages as they were excellent way to end a day.  Re:facial- rejuvenating and collagen/oxygen facials were 2 facials that I had and would highly recommend.  After 2 weeks of stay, I am a few kilos lighter, I truly enjoyed my stay. Special thanks to the GM, coaches, chef, spa and office staff  who made my stay at REVIVO one of the best resort experiences
title: Highly recommended- Amazing and dedicated staff will pamper your stay at REVIVO

text: my husband and I just spent 8 days at revivo. we stayed in villa 6 with a massive private pool. We did not do a wellness package, rather decided to relax and just pick what we wanted to do while we were there. I had massages every day and they were really good as was the manicure and pedicure. I have to say that this is the most beautiful wellness resort we have been to. We spent a week in a very expensive place in koh samui 2 years ago and this was far better and cheaper. The staff are divine and greet you by name every time they see you. The GM, sammy, took me for a tour of the organic garden and they are very proud of the set up and the efforts they go to - which is well justified as it was a very impressive garden area. The place is very private and we only saw three other guests the entire stay, so you feel like you have the whole joint to yourself!! The food was organic and incredible. we both lost a couple of kilos just by eating the very tasty and healthy meals. The size portions were good and I loved every meal that i ordered. the breakfast was particularly awesome with organic duck eggs and asian greens. I have never slept so well as on this trip and felt amazing when we left. It is a truly beautiful place where the grounds are kept impeccably tidy and the room was huge. We asked for a tv to be put in our villa so we could watch movies and this was organised without fuss. Just a great place to go and I encourage anyone to try it out as opposed to the more well known wellness retreats of thailand.
title: wow - simply amazing

text: Really enjoyed my short stay at REVIVO - I was very satisfied and thought the service was consistently great and friendly.  I was particularly impressed with the attention to guests' expected needs - such as in-car wifi, complimentary snacks, yoga wear, insect repellent, sarong.  This is wonderful choice for a short stay for wellness / refresher given its secluded location.  The spa and the food were both really fantastic!  I wish had more time to try different treatments and the food and drink choices.  It's nice to see a place where you can have meats too - often people expect "healthy choices" to be meat free.  I love the colours on the plate.  The "moveo" program (at the moment) has one of yoga, fitness and a meditation class - which works well for me but for anyone looking for more of an intense workout, there are limited choices.  Though I did mention secluded, it is actually just conveniently 20 minutes away from the airport and if you want to get out to Nusa Dua, I believe they can take you out for shopping and the beach etc.  The room was also of a good size - and I had a small outdoor area where I can chill and read.  I hope to return again!
title: Perfect for a short retreat

text:
リゾート全体に漂う温かい思いやり溢れる雰囲気、どこを見ても写真の世界、ヘルシーであっても美味しい食事に充実したアクティビティや熟練のセラピストによるスパメニュー・・ここは楽園でしょうか？というくらいに毎日本当に幸せに過ごしました。
ウェルネスリゾートということでそれぞれの目的に合ったプログラムを組んでもらえ、ただの宿としての滞在であってもそういったプログラムのための滞在であっても、間違えなく最高の時間が過ごせます。
正直ここまでしっかりとスタッフ全員のモチベーションとプロ意識が整ったリゾートは類を見ないと感じます。近隣の高級リゾートで受けるホスピタリティが三流と思わせるほどの最高のサービスと本物の真心こもったサービスが受けられます。
バリに来たことがあってもなくても、現地の明るく朗らかなスタッフの皆さんとの交流も一つの大きな喜びなのではないでしょうか。一人ひとりとお話するとそれぞれとても色々なことを教えてくれ、まるでバリに家族ができたような感覚です。
私個人としてはプログラムに参加し、朝からヨガでしっかり体をほぐしてから一日中様々なアクティビティやスパメニューを受けたことで心も体もすっかり元気に健やかに充電されました。かなりお勧めです。
絶対に近くまた戻ってきます。宜しくお願い致します。
title: まさに楽園

text:
J'ai passé une semaine à REVIVO au mois d'août 2019.
REVIVO n'est pas un simple hôtel. C'est beaucoup plus que ça ! C'est un univers de bien-être, un bain de bienveillance, un lieu de retrouvailles avec son corps, avec soi-même.
Ici, tout est personnalisé : soins, activités, repas, massage. Tout est mis en place pour vous reconnecter avec votre être, retrouver équilibre et bien-être.

REVIVO c'est un aussi un hôtel : un hôtel dans un cadre de rêve, une cuisine exceptionnelle, des chambres qui sont en fait une maison avec son jardin, sa piscine privée, sa terrasse.

Mais si je peux donner un conseil, ne réservez pas les chambres uniquement, sans profiter de quelques jours du programme personnalisé par l'équipe. Vous ne le regretterez pas.

Le paradis.
A vivre et revivre encore.

J'y retournerai. Forcement.
title: Une pause magique

text:
Revivo est un splendide resort où tout est fabuleux : les soins du Spa avec Minarni, les cours de Yoga avec Johana, les cours de boxe et de stretching avec Jaka. Un merveilleux endroit pour totalement déconnecter de tout ! Aucun bruit artificiel, seuls les oiseaux animent l'ambiance sonore en chantant (j'imagine qu'ils aiment eux aussi vivre dans un tel paradis !).
La nourriture est somptueuse et tous les jus de fruits pressés à la minute sont succulents. Dans les chambres les infusions glacées offertes sont très agréables à découvrir (je vous recommande le rosella tea infusé glacé). Cet endroit est magique !
title: Fabuleux moments paradisiaques

text:
Absolutely amazing Everything but in particular the staff! Every member of the staff knew my name and treated me in such a friendly and welcoming way that made me feel at home! The rooms are beautiful and spacious, the resort has everything you need, various pools as well as sauna, jacuzzi, etc. It is not crowded with guests so it made you feel like you had the place for yourself. I absolutely recommend it!!!

I took the Mind and body retreat, the schedule was packed with loads of great surprises: classes (a vast variety with great teachers! They included Vinyasa yoga, Ashtanga yoga, Tai chi, Qi Gong, TRX, Aqua Yoga, etc), great spaces to meditate, exceptional healthy but flavoursome food, experienced and really friendly and professional teachers, incredible body and face treatments, a great retreat consultant and a team willing to go the extra mile to make your stay unforgettable (from the pick up with delicious fresh mango juices and dreamy cookies to the daily attention and even took me to trips to the nearby beach) ... everything was nothing less than perfect! This is the best investment I've made this year :) ... I needed this break as I am going through difficult times in my life but this gave me all I needed to go on, to restart and as a rebirth (Revivo!) ... I came back home like new and still miss this paradise. Thanks to all the staff for making my stay truly unforgettable and for making me feel so special!

Absolutamente espectacular! Todo pero especialmente la atención de sus trabajadores! Cada persona del staff sabia mi nombre y me trataba de una forma tan cordial y amigable que me hizo sentir como en casa! Las habitaciones son preciosas y muy espaciosas, el resort tiene varias piscinas, jacuzzi, spa, etc. Está muy bien diseñado que sientes que el resort es casi privado para ti, aunque haya otros guests. Recomendado a todos! 

Yo tome uno de sus retreats (Mind and body retreat), el plan diario estaba lleno de grandes sorpresas: las clases ofrecían una gran variedad con muy buenos profesores (incluían Vinyasa yoga, Ashtanga yoga, Tai chi, Qi Gong, TRX, Aqua Yoga, etc), fabulosos espacios para meditar, comida muy saludable pero llena de explosiones de sabores, profesores muy experimentados, amigables y profesionales, tratamientos para cuerpo y cara exquisitos, una consultora del retreat muy buena y un equipo que estaba dispuesto a hacer todo lo necesario para hacer mi estadía absolutamente inolvidable (desde el segundo que me recogieron con un delicioso jugo de mango y galletas deliciosisimas!, hasta su perfecta atención diaria, hasta me llevaron en viajes privados a la playa cercana) ... todo fue absolutamente perfecto! ... Yo necesitaba este escape ya que estoy pasando por  momentos un poco difíciles, pero este retiro me dio todo lo que necesito para continuar, para recomenzar como su nombre lo dice ... renacer (Revivo) ... volví a casa como nueva y aún extraño estar allí! Gracias a todo el staff por hacer de mi estadía algo inolvidable!!! Y por hacerme sentir muy especial en cada momento!
title: Mind and body retreat - An experience that I will cherish forever :)

text:
J'ai passé une semaine à Revivo, ce fut une des meilleures semaines de ma vie ! 
Le lieu est magique, le service est digne des plus grands hôtels, la nourriture est délicieuse et healthy, les cours de sport sont d'une très bon niveau, le spa offre un excellent service et de très bons massages. 
J'ai réellement eu la chance de faire une vraie coupure grâce à Revivo et toutes ses équipes que je remercie de tout mon coeur. Je n'ai qu'un regret, que ce soit déjà fini !
title: Expérience inoubliable

Votre avis spécifique sur notre villa est bien noté, soigneusement traité et très apprécié. Toute l'équipe de REVĪVŌ Wellness Resorts vous remercie d'avoir reconnu les efforts déployés pour faire de votre séjour un moment inoubliable et agréable.

Nous espérons toujours et nous nous réjouissons de vous accueillir à nouveau dans votre REVĪVŌ Wellness Resorts Bali. Si vous avez des commentaires ou des questions, je resterai personnellement à votre entière disposition.
